quiz.question: Which component of the CPU is responsible for performing arithmetic and logic operations?
quiz.hint: This component is abbreviated as ALU.

quiz.question: What is the primary purpose of cache memory in a computer system?
options: To improve processing speed by storing frequently accessed data
To connect the CPU to peripheral devices
To back up data in case of power failure
quiz.hint: Cache memory acts as a high-speed buffer between the CPU and RAM.

quiz.question: Which of the following best describes an instruction set in computer architecture?
options: A series of bits used to represent data
A collection of commands a CPU can execute
The physical layout of a CPU
quiz.hint: It's a set of operations a processor can perform.

quiz.question: What is the function of the control unit within the CPU?
options: To manage the execution of instructions
To connect the CPU to external devices
quiz.hint: The control unit directs the operation of the processor.

quiz.question: Which type of device is primarily used for input in a computer system?
quiz.hint: This device is used to enter data and commands into a computer.
